results.title: Effect of simvastatin topical use on alveolar bone after tooth extraction: a scoping review.
results.text_hl: Among four RCTs on @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008269 @@@postoperative swelling@@@, only two observed a significant increase in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Diniz JA, Dourado ACAG, Barbirato DDS, da Silveira KG, Vasconcellos RJH, Laureano Filho JR. Effect of simvastatin topical use on alveolar bone after tooth extraction: a scoping review. Clin Oral Investig. 2024 Jan 10;28(1):86. PMID: 38195898
citations.BibTeX: @article{38195898, title={Effect of simvastatin topical use on alveolar bone after tooth extraction: a scoping review.}, author={Diniz JA and Dourado ACAG and Barbirato DDS and da Silveira KG and Vasconcellos RJH and Laureano Filho JR}, journal={Clin Oral Investig}, volume={28}, number={1}, pages={86}}

results.title: Low intravitreal angiopoietin-2 and VEGF levels in vitrectomized diabetic patients with simvastatin treatment.
results.text_hl: In @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetics@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008269 @@@macular oedema@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Macular_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008269 @@@DME@@@), intravitreal @GENE_ANGPT2 @GENE_285 @@@Ang-2@@@ (p = 0.006) and @GENE_VEGFA @GENE_7422 @@@VEGF@@@ (p = 0.002) levels were lower in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ compared with non-statin-treated controls.

citations.NLM: Tuuminen R, Sahanne S, Loukovaara S. Low intravitreal angiopoietin-2 and VEGF levels in vitrectomized diabetic patients with simvastatin treatment. Acta Ophthalmol. 2014 Nov;92(7):675-81. PMID: 24506800
citations.BibTeX: @article{24506800, title={Low intravitreal angiopoietin-2 and VEGF levels in vitrectomized diabetic patients with simvastatin treatment.}, author={Tuuminen R and Sahanne S and Loukovaara S}, journal={Acta Ophthalmol}, volume={92}, number={7}, pages={675-81}}

results.title: Simvastatin retards progression of retinopathy in diabetic patients with hypercholesterolemia.
results.text_hl: Fifty @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@ (@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@Type 1 and 2@@@) with good glycemic control and @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@ and having @DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@ (non-clinically significant @<m>DISEASE_Macular_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008269 @@@macular edema@@@ and visual acuity 6/24 or better) in either or both eyes were randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20-mg per day or placebo, and were followed up for 180 days.

citations.NLM: Sen K, Misra A, Kumar A, Pandey RM. Simvastatin retards progression of retinopathy in diabetic patients with hypercholesterolemia. Diabetes Res Clin Pract. 2002 Apr;56(1):1-11. PMID: 11879715
citations.BibTeX: @article{11879715, title={Simvastatin retards progression of retinopathy in diabetic patients with hypercholesterolemia.}, author={Sen K and Misra A and Kumar A and Pandey RM}, journal={Diabetes Res Clin Pract}, volume={56}, number={1}, pages={1-11}}
